articles.headline: California Fire Now the Largest in State History: ‘People Are on Edge’
articles.snippet: A pair of fires called the Mendocino Complex had been growing for nearly two weeks before becoming the largest fire on Monday night.
articles.abstract: A pair of fires called the Mendocino Complex had been growing for nearly two weeks before becoming the largest fire on Monday night.
articles.lead_paragraph: MATHER, Calif. — Inside the state’s emergency command center here, the numbers on a large screen show the scope and reach of California’s record-setting wildfire season glowing in red, blue and yellow: nearly 600,000 acres burned. More than 13,000 firefighters battling blazes. More than 2,300 members of the National Guard pulled into the fight.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Jennifer Medina

articles.headline: Goldman Sachs Is Said to Be Under U.S. Scrutiny in Malaysian Inquiry
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn are investigating what role the firm may have played in the so-called 1MDB scandal, according to four people familiar with the inquiry.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn are investigating what role the firm may have played in the so-called 1MDB scandal, according to four people familiar with the inquiry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Los Angeles drafted a criminal complaint against a former Goldman Sachs banker early this year for his alleged role in a vast Malaysian fraud, but the charges were never filed because of a Justice Department turf battle, according to two people familiar with the investigation.

articles.headline: Elon Musk Says Tesla May Go Private, and Its Stock Soars
articles.snippet: Tesla’s chief executive suggested that being a public company, beholden to shareholders, created perverse incentives for short-sellers.
articles.abstract: Tesla’s chief executive suggested that being a public company, beholden to shareholders, created perverse incentives for short-sellers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk has become one of the world’s most prominent chief executives, and a billionaire several times over, by boldly making big bets on ideas that few others thought possible.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette and Matt Phillips

articles.headline: Ikea Opens First India Store, Tweaking Products but Not the Vibe
articles.snippet: The Swedish furniture giant opens in Hyderabad, India, this week. To appeal to customers, it is cutting prices, offering assembly and selling samosas.
articles.abstract: The Swedish furniture giant opens in Hyderabad, India, this week. To appeal to customers, it is cutting prices, offering assembly and selling samosas.
articles.lead_paragraph: HYDERABAD, India — Parina Lamba, 4, knew what she wanted in the new Ikea store here, the first by the Swedish retail giant in India. She hopped onto a daybed on the showroom floor, lay down and would not get off.

articles.headline: Customers Used to Come for a Loan. Now, They Come for Pizza.
articles.snippet: A downward trend in banking is opening up real estate opportunities as investors convert former branches to other uses, including churches, pharmacies and pizza parlors.
articles.abstract: A downward trend in banking is opening up real estate opportunities as investors convert former branches to other uses, including churches, pharmacies and pizza parlors.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAGNOLIA, Tex. — David White was scouting this fast-growing community near Houston in 2016 in search of a site for his planned hamburger-chili parlor. The most promising candidate was a vacated suburban bank adjacent to a small shopping center.

articles.headline: Snap’s Drop in Active Users Could Signal a Social Media Peak
articles.snippet: The maker of Snapchat said it lost 3 million daily active users in the latest quarter, following similar drops or flattening growth from Facebook and Twitter.
articles.abstract: The maker of Snapchat said it lost 3 million daily active users in the latest quarter, following similar drops or flattening growth from Facebook and Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For years, people seemed to have an unlimited appetite for signing up for social media services. Now some of those companies may be hitting a wall to adding new users.

articles.headline: Top Trump Campaign Aides Are Portrayed as Corrupt at Manafort Trial
articles.snippet: The prosecution’s star witness, Rick Gates, detailed a yearslong fraud by Paul Manafort. Defense lawyers assailed Mr. Gates’s credibility, pointing to thefts, lies and an extramarital affair.
articles.abstract: The prosecution’s star witness, Rick Gates, detailed a yearslong fraud by Paul Manafort. Defense lawyers assailed Mr. Gates’s credibility, pointing to thefts, lies and an extramarital affair.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALEXANDRIA, Va. — The trial of Paul Manafort turned into a referendum on the character of two of President Trump’s top campaign aides on Tuesday, as prosecutors cast Mr. Manafort as the architect of a sprawling swindle and defense lawyers portrayed the prosecution’s star witness as a thief, adulterer and liar.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: Ohio Special Election Too Close to Call, as Republican Holds Slim Lead
articles.snippet: Despite millions of dollars in advertising and interventions from President Trump and Vice President Pence, the Republican candidate had a razor-thin lead over a little-known Democrat.
articles.abstract: Despite millions of dollars in advertising and interventions from President Trump and Vice President Pence, the Republican candidate had a razor-thin lead over a little-known Democrat.
articles.lead_paragraph: • Get full results from Ohio’s special election here.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Trump’s Tariffs Are Changing Trade With China. Here Are 2 Emerging Endgames.
articles.snippet: Beneath the acrimony, two potential paths for China seem to be emerging in the trade war with the United States.
articles.abstract: Beneath the acrimony, two potential paths for China seem to be emerging in the trade war with the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The United States and China have sparred repeatedly over trade, in a tit-for-tat skirmish that has shown little sign of abating. High-level talks have stalled, while both sides have been threatening further tariffs in recent days.

articles.headline: In Lebanon Town, Refugees and Locals Agree on 1 Thing: Time for Syrians to Go
articles.snippet: Residents of Arsal, which had four times as many Syrians as local residents, hope the winding down of the Syrian war will allow refugees to return.
articles.abstract: Residents of Arsal, which had four times as many Syrians as local residents, hope the winding down of the Syrian war will allow refugees to return.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARSAL, Lebanon — The mayor was tired. Asleep-at-3, awake-at-6 tired. Tired the way you cannot help but be after years of the Islamic State squatting in your town, killing your citizens and forcing the army to quarantine you from the rest of the country.

articles.headline: Republicans Gird for House Battle as Ohio and Kansas Races Remain Close
articles.snippet: Voting across the Midwest and West this week laid bare the party’s precarious position in the November midterm elections, particularly its vulnerabilities in suburbs and with moderate voters.
articles.abstract: Voting across the Midwest and West this week laid bare the party’s precarious position in the November midterm elections, particularly its vulnerabilities in suburbs and with moderate voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alarmed by the tight race for a congressional seat in Ohio, Republicans are steeling for a 90-day campaign of trench warfare as they fight to keep control of the House, pinning their hopes on well-funded outside groups and a slashing negative message about Democrats.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Did Elon Musk Violate Securities Laws With Tweet About Taking Tesla Private?
articles.snippet: Mr. Musk’s statement that he had “funding secured” for a possible $70 billion buyout could get scrutiny from securities regulators and plaintiffs’ lawyers.
articles.abstract: Mr. Musk’s statement that he had “funding secured” for a possible $70 billion buyout could get scrutiny from securities regulators and plaintiffs’ lawyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk had better be right.
